commit_message:
Don't rely on testtools.tests

We can't import testtools.tests because although we depend on
testtools, its test-requirements may not be available to us. So
just "inline" what we need from testtools.tests.

See I33564b06e9a2b128e892f0b598cfc71f71a7794a and
I0a34ae7b7000760a1be105c8c082b8aaa8e079e4 for more history and
this issue.

Change-Id: I4d67aafb3dcdefa105782883cd044b09ba5ee966
Closes-bug: #1634972

commit_message:
Remove 'fill(0)' and fix influx time offset

If a measurement lands exactly on a second boundary, it
could be excluded from the proper statistics bucket.

Also changed influx statistics queries to only return
periods where data exists.

Change-Id: I13355662e36ab1d3535dd1cebbe7d4ec128e1cd0

subject: Adds support for disks on HP Smart Array Controllers
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-21 15:15:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_data_disk.yml'], 'message': "Adds support for disks on HP Smart Array Controllers

This commit adds handling for RAID controllers which use the cciss driver.
Ansible detects devices attached to this driver with the format of
'cciss!c#d#', whereas commands run using the ansible provided name expect the
format of 'cciss/c#d#' or 'cciss/c#d#p#'.

Change-Id: I4062a5df0dd5a05e08aac566d3f564a081bebd01
Closes-Bug: #1634318
(cherry picked from commit f785060cfcff4224c64885a5294335b2bb9b2c5f)
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for disks on HP Smart Array Controllers

This commit adds handling for RAID controllers which use the cciss driver.
Ansible detects devices attached to this driver with the format of
'cciss!c#d#', whereas commands run using the ansible provided name expect the
format of 'cciss/c#d#' or 'cciss/c#d#p#'.

Change-Id: I4062a5df0dd5a05e08aac566d3f564a081bebd01
Closes-Bug: #1634318
(cherry picked from commit f785060cfcff4224c64885a5294335b2bb9b2c5f)

commit_message:
Require coverage>=4.0 to use --concurrency

The 4.0 release of the coverage library added the --concurrency
option to use when running tests on a repo that uses a threading
library such as eventlet, like nova.

Change-Id: I5fb934e17d9af7142aa59bd36e3e7a38388f942d

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2016-10-21 11:25:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Use devstack git_clone

Following commits changes manual
git clone to git_clone from devstack
common functions.

That allows monasca devstack plugin
to use globals ``ERROR_ON_CLONE``,
``OFFLINE`` and ``RECLONE`` as defined by
devstack. Also it will be possible to specify
branches and repositories for monasca components
directly before stacking for the first time

Closes-Bug: 1625488
Change-Id: I3d16eca203a3428749de6e478da3dd92327ea7bf
'}]
commit_message:
Use devstack git_clone

Following commits changes manual
git clone to git_clone from devstack
common functions.

That allows monasca devstack plugin
to use globals ``ERROR_ON_CLONE``,
``OFFLINE`` and ``RECLONE`` as defined by
devstack. Also it will be possible to specify
branches and repositories for monasca components
directly before stacking for the first time

Closes-Bug: 1625488
Change-Id: I3d16eca203a3428749de6e478da3dd92327ea7bf

commit_message:
Fix BaseTestCase bug

Fixes a bug in BTC that causes syntribos to send the same init_req over
and over, meaning that only the first template specified actually gets
executed.

Change-Id: I9df3de8ae8ac305d67428afc9c029d2145788b53
Closes-Bug: #1635747

subject: Fixes process checker using older psutil versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 14273, 'name': 'Joe Keen', 'email': 'joe.keen@hpe.com', 'username': 'jkeen'}, {'_account_id': 15027, 'name': 'Michael Hoppal', 'email': 'michael.jam.hoppal@hpe.com', 'username': 'michael-hoppal'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trębski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 20033, 'name': 'Artur Basiak', 'email': 'artur.basiak@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'abasiak'}, {'_account_id': 20873, 'name': 'Laszlo Hegedus', 'email': 'hegedues.laszlo@gmail.com', 'username': 'laszloh'}, {'_account_id': 22157, 'name': 'Andrea Adams', 'email': 'aadams@hpe.com', 'username': 'andrea.adams'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-10-11 16:44:13.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/process.py', 'requirements.txt', 'tests/test_process.py'], 'message': 'Fixes process checker using older psutil versions

Generally, psutil is restricted to versions older than 2.0.0
in OpenStack [1].

Because of this, there can exist nodes with psutil older than 2.0.0.

The data from Process object are accessed differently, depending on
the version. For example, in older versions, this is valid:

process.name()
process.pid
process.username()
process.cmdline()

While in older versions than 2.0.0, those are not methods:

process.name
process.pid
process.username
process.cmdline

Transforming the Process object into a dict solves the issue, as it
behaves the same across different psutil versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L142

Closes-Bug: #1592695

Change-Id: I9b0ff7a666ac9900809f8e4dc07d2b2afbe43516
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes process checker using older psutil versions

Generally, psutil is restricted to versions older than 2.0.0
in OpenStack [1].

Because of this, there can exist nodes with psutil older than 2.0.0.

The data from Process object are accessed differently, depending on
the version. For example, in older versions, this is valid:

process.name()
process.pid
process.username()
process.cmdline()

While in older versions than 2.0.0, those are not methods:

process.name
process.pid
process.username
process.cmdline

Transforming the Process object into a dict solves the issue, as it
behaves the same across different psutil versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L142

Closes-Bug: #1592695

Change-Id: I9b0ff7a666ac9900809f8e4dc07d2b2afbe43516

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-20 20:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovsdb/native/test_connection.py'], 'message': "[WIP] Make OVSDB native lib more customizable

Moves non-Neutron-specific code out of impl_idl so outside
projects don't have to import neutron-specific code that resides
in impl_idl.py. Also moves changes the api of the Connection class
to require the passing of a factory function that returns an Idl

Connection class altogether.

Change-Id: I35ea8b09ac1d7762ced3c9b732142291608d72bf
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Make OVSDB native lib more customizable

Moves non-Neutron-specific code out of impl_idl so outside
projects don't have to import neutron-specific code that resides
in impl_idl.py. Also moves changes the api of the Connection class
to require the passing of a factory function that returns an Idl
instance. This moves all of the schema-handling stuff out of the
Connection class altogether.

This is an API-breaking change. It is still undecided whether
backwards-compatibility should be maintained.

Change-Id: I35ea8b09ac1d7762ced3c9b732142291608d72bf

commit_message:
Introduce API definition for trunk/trunk_details extensions

This patch serves as a trail blazer for Neutron API consolidation. It
introduces the following:

 * It provides the API definitions to be used by a Neutron Stadium project.
 * It introduces some testing scaffolding to validate the correctness of
   an API definition and coverage for the extension.
 * It provides the API reference documentation for the extension.

More patches will follow up to consolidate the rest of the Neutron APIs and
will use this as an example/template on how to approach the consolidation
effort.

Change-Id: Ie620a6fc21916ab34a19632c7fb9456b2c7c43b1

To be able to monitor during deployment, we need sensu clients
and fluentd collectors be deployed as soon as it is possible.

commit_message:
Composable Mistral services

Adds new puppet specific services for Mistral
API and Mistral Engine.

This submission enables the mistral service by default in the
overcloud, a following submission will disable it and make it
optional by enabling it on demand based in an environment file.

Depends-On: Iae42ffa37c4c9b1e070b7c3753e04c45bb97703f
Depends-On: I942d419be951651e305d01460f394870c30a9878
Depends-On: I6cb2cbf4a2abf494668d24b8c36b0d525643f0af
Implements: blueprint composable-services-within-roles
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Camacho <ccamacho@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id5ff9cb498b5a47af38413d211ff0ed6ccd0015b

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: If6ecada10cd963d77eb233e109266ecc0673958a

commit_message:
Prefill Sensu client custom config

- Custom config has to contain OpenStack auth information,
  so it has to be generated for user during deployment.
  This patch maintains the ability to provide a custom
  configuration for the Sensu client.

Change-Id: If449642c4bbad683421e1f461b8721e655db0c45

commit_message:
Add special case handling for OVS upgrade in updates and upgrades

This adds a special case handling for the opensvswitch package
as discussed at the related bug below.
This is added/handled here for both the minor update and the
major mitaka...newton upgrade.

Change-Id: I9b1f0eaa0d36a28e20b507bec6a4e9b3af1781ae
Closes-Bug: 1635205
(cherry picked from 7e09b70bc336b70be9042c8971ad020c6343d6c2)

commit_message:
Clarify horizon allowed hosts setting

Horizon allowed hosts should name the IP addresses/
DNS names (short/long) the Horizon node is listening to.
Allowed hosts is used for header checks and is a security
mechanism.

Change-Id: I81c96357f969a1a436eecd35eb178579159bc719

subject: Add support for volumev3 service type
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 12:08:34.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'message': "Add support for volumev3 service type

Words cannot begin to adequately express the disappointment and rage I
felt upon learning that the cinder team had unleashed 'volumev3' upon
the world. Woe betide us, the mere users, for wanting to use a 'volume'
endpoint and have that choice mean something. Perhaps if we beat
ourselves with leather straps while crawling for days across the country
we can remove more joy from our lives. In the meantime, until we can
fully appreciate the existential crisis of being, let's continue to work
around it in os-client-config.

Change-Id: I171e3b01497b3e3a06c3a73577f0f67e0c1e6f73
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for volumev3 service type

Words cannot begin to adequately express the disappointment and rage I
felt upon learning that the cinder team had unleashed 'volumev3' upon
the world. Woe betide us, the mere users, for wanting to use a 'volume'
endpoint and have that choice mean something. Perhaps if we beat
ourselves with leather straps while crawling for days across the country
we can remove more joy from our lives. In the meantime, until we can
fully appreciate the existential crisis of being, let's continue to work
around it in os-client-config.

Change-Id: I171e3b01497b3e3a06c3a73577f0f67e0c1e6f73

overcloud-opstools element and makes it a dependency of the
overcloud-* elements.  It also adds the missing fluentd secure-forward
plugin package.

Change-Id: I4df1bb0c4fdc3211ef32aaa112d1c46063c85309
'}]
commit_message:
update required packages for opstools support

the packages required for opstools support (fluentd, sensu, and
related) were duplicated across all the overcloud elements.

this consolidates the opstools packages into a single
overcloud-opstools element and makes it a dependency of the
overcloud-* elements.  It also adds the missing fluentd secure-forward
plugin package.

Change-Id: I4df1bb0c4fdc3211ef32aaa112d1c46063c85309

commit_message:
Modified dry_run to run debug test

Wrote empty debug test as a replacement for dry_run. dry_run no longer executes
any test code, or send any requests. Rather, it serves only to check that the
template file and all external calls inside the template are parsed and run
correctly.

Change-Id: I1cd817476c9ca4bd27b013dcdbd0cbce334847c4

subject: Fix TypeError in list_router_interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 09:31:45.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Fix TypeError in list_router_interfaces

It turns out, you can have a router object with a 'external_gateway_info'
key that is set to None. In that case, list_router_interfaces fail with

  File "../shade/openstackcloud.py", line 2624, in list_router_interfaces
    'external_fixed_ips' in router['external_gateway_info']):
TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

How to repro
1) Create a router: neutron router-create foo
2) Run
import os_client_config, shade

cloud = os_client_config.make_shade(cloud='devstack')
router = cloud.get_router('foo')
cloud.list_router_interfaces(router, 'external')

Change-Id: I4c2894355958a7142670e186e7932048d66cfd59
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in list_router_interfaces

It turns out, you can have a router object with a 'external_gateway_info'
key that is set to None. In that case, list_router_interfaces fail with

  File "../shade/openstackcloud.py", line 2624, in list_router_interfaces
    'external_fixed_ips' in router['external_gateway_info']):
TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

How to repro
1) Create a router: neutron router-create foo
2) Run
import os_client_config, shade

cloud = os_client_config.make_shade(cloud='devstack')
router = cloud.get_router('foo')
cloud.list_router_interfaces(router, 'external')

Change-Id: I4c2894355958a7142670e186e7932048d66cfd59

commit_message:
networking-odl: use ubuntu-xenial for newton+

netorwking-odl from newton requires ovs 2.4+ which is provided ubuntu
xenial. So update projects definition to use ubuntu-xenial nodes instead
of ubuntu-trusty.
For older release(liberty and mitaka), ubuntu-trusty is kept.
At the same time, this patch make tempest-dvsm jobs voting for newton+.

Change-Id: I266028ff7dac7f348603445db71ca860e2071461
Closes-bug: #1632352

subject: Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 16:12:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceilometer_install.yml', 'tests/test-install-mongodb.yml'], 'message': "Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ide6ae6a5ea5d2279c42003f379b3a3460e62a525
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2ef2b9e735fdb63abd4763f2bdfc92b3ca86aa97)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ide6ae6a5ea5d2279c42003f379b3a3460e62a525
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2ef2b9e735fdb63abd4763f2bdfc92b3ca86aa97)

subject: Use dictionary for service group mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-21 15:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'templates/ceilometer-systemd-init.j2', 'tasks/ceilometer_init_common.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_init_systemd.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_init.yml', 'templates/ceilometer-systemd-tempfiles.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_init_upstart.yml', 'templates/ceilometer-upstart-init.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'ceilometer_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/378760
- https://review.openstack.org/380463
- https://review.openstack.org/385697 (partial)

Change-Id: I417f366e343a7b764e3bcd9ab75efc3a233b460b
(cherry picked from commit 282de190749899afa9c8927d5c145ae4f6d23bfd)
"}]
commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'ceilometer_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/378760
- https://review.openstack.org/380463
- https://review.openstack.org/385697 (partial)

Change-Id: I417f366e343a7b764e3bcd9ab75efc3a233b460b
(cherry picked from commit 282de190749899afa9c8927d5c145ae4f6d23bfd)

commit_message:
Use correct password for keystone bootstrap

In upstream puppet-keystone, the boostrap process should use an admin
password not the admin token for the bootstrapping of keystone. The
admin password option is being added to the upstream class so we will
need to provide it to properly have keystone bootstrapped.

Change-Id: Icab4b0cb70d6caf2f2792c4fe730f060b807fbc1
Depends-On: I7a706d93b43ec025bdb4b29667f64ff2f7dd52a0
Related-Bug: #1621959

commit_message:
Ensure self-signed certificates are distributed

Currently when executing the role across multiple hosts
and using self-signed certificates, each host has its
own certificates.

This patch uses the same model as os_keystone to
facilitate SSL key/cert distribution across multiple
hosts if the cert is self-signed.

Change-Id: I0a4a2340a56aa657380d7fa49be24a0c4407d070
Closes-Bug: #1635274
(cherry picked from commit 313fffc71748d319953e97c6d48aec12ff7913b7)

Currently when executing the role across multiple hosts
and using self-signed certificates, each host has its

This patch uses the same model as os_keystone to

Closes-Bug: #1635274
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure self-signed certificates are distributed

Currently when executing the role across multiple hosts
and using self-signed certificates, each host has its
own certificates.

This patch uses the same model as os_keystone to
facilitate SSL key/cert distribution across multiple
hosts if the cert is self-signed.

Change-Id: I0a4a2340a56aa657380d7fa49be24a0c4407d070
Closes-Bug: #1635274

subject: PoC Dynamic iPXE with core+vendor API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7900, 'name': 'Tomasz Paszkowski', 'email': 'ss7pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'tpaszkowski'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19003, 'name': 'Fujitsu iRMC CI', 'email': 'fj-lsoft-irmcci@dl.jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'Fujitsu_iRMC_CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 10:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/__init__.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/ramdisk.py', 'ironic/api/config.py', 'ironic/conf/api.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/versions.py', 'ironic/drivers/agent.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/common/pxe_utils.py', 'ironic/common/policy.py', 'ironic/common/ipxe_utils.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipxe.j2'], 'message': 'PoC Dynamic iPXE with core+vendor API

Adds new endpoint `v1/ipxe` to serve iPXE boot scripts
directly from Ironic API.

The endpoint is public and requires no authentication.
Note that although API version is bumped to 1.23, this endpoint does not
check the requested API version and relies solely on config option
enabling it, as iPXE firmware can not insert custom HTTP request headers.

New config options to this regard:

- `CONF.pxe.enable_ipxe_server` to enable this new API (default is False)
- `CONF.api.restrict_ipxe` to restrict iPXE config fetch to only nodes
  in appropriate states (default is True), similar to
  CONF.api.restrict_lookup
- `CONF.api.ipxe_script_template` points to Jinja2 template of iPXE
  boot script, default is $pybasedir/drivers/modules/ipxe.j2

To support this feature deploy driver interfaces are expected
to inherit from new `IPXEDeployMixin` class and implement
`get_ipxe_options` method.
This patch adds implementation based on AgentDeploy as IPXEAgentDeploy
interface.

Boot script API:

Request: GET v1/ipxe?mac=<mac>&node_uuid=<node-uuid>

Description:
resolves Ironic API and renders Jinja template
for iPXE boot script directly in API w/o RPC calls to conductor.
Both `mac` and `node_uuid` are optional but at least one of them must be
provided, with node_uuid taking precedence.
Using the `?mac=` form is mostly suitable for standalone Ironic
where external DHCP server can be pre-configured to generate
appropriate PXE opts for DHCP response using the MAC of requester.

Boot config:

Request: GET v1/nodes/<node-uuid>/vendor_passthru/ipxe_config

Description:
implemented as vendor passthru extension, this call fetches boot config
and then serves it from API.

Change-Id: I5d2b275e6f0ecfe6dcaf63ef9d6ad73f4a47b191
Related-Bug: #1526275
'}]
commit_message:
PoC Dynamic iPXE with core+vendor API

Adds new endpoint `v1/ipxe` to serve iPXE boot scripts
directly from Ironic API.

The endpoint is public and requires no authentication.
Note that although API version is bumped to 1.23, this endpoint does not
check the requested API version and relies solely on config option
enabling it, as iPXE firmware can not insert custom HTTP request headers.

New config options to this regard:

- `CONF.pxe.enable_ipxe_server` to enable this new API (default is False)
- `CONF.api.restrict_ipxe` to restrict iPXE config fetch to only nodes
  in appropriate states (default is True), similar to
  CONF.api.restrict_lookup
- `CONF.api.ipxe_script_template` points to Jinja2 template of iPXE
  boot script, default is $pybasedir/drivers/modules/ipxe.j2

To support this feature deploy driver interfaces are expected
to inherit from new `IPXEDeployMixin` class and implement
`get_ipxe_options` method.
This patch adds implementation based on AgentDeploy as IPXEAgentDeploy
interface.

Boot script API:

Request: GET v1/ipxe?mac=<mac>&node_uuid=<node-uuid>

Description:
resolves Ironic API and renders Jinja template
for iPXE boot script directly in API w/o RPC calls to conductor.
Both `mac` and `node_uuid` are optional but at least one of them must be
provided, with node_uuid taking precedence.
Using the `?mac=` form is mostly suitable for standalone Ironic
where external DHCP server can be pre-configured to generate
appropriate PXE opts for DHCP response using the MAC of requester.

Boot config:

Request: GET v1/nodes/<node-uuid>/vendor_passthru/ipxe_config

Description:
implemented as vendor passthru extension, this call fetches boot config
and then serves it from API.

Change-Id: I5d2b275e6f0ecfe6dcaf63ef9d6ad73f4a47b191
Related-Bug: #1526275

as discussed at the related bug below.

major mitaka...newton upgrade.

subject: Implement upper constraints for Ansible bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-18 19:12:08.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Implement upper constraints for Ansible bootstrap

Currently the Ansible bootstrap does not make use of upper
constraints, resulting in an inconsistent set of package
versions for the same tag.

This patch ensures that the upper constraints are applied
to the Ansible bootstrap.

This, much like the pinning we do elsewhere, ensures that
when OpenStack-Ansible is installed from a tag it uses the
exact same package versions as those that were tested and
it produces consistent results.

Change-Id: I61499631fa211ea482c79b2067d09889d9530b40
'}]
commit_message:
Implement upper constraints for Ansible bootstrap

Currently the Ansible bootstrap does not make use of upper
constraints, resulting in an inconsistent set of package
versions for the same tag.

This patch ensures that the upper constraints are applied
to the Ansible bootstrap.

This, much like the pinning we do elsewhere, ensures that
when OpenStack-Ansible is installed from a tag it uses the
exact same package versions as those that were tested and
it produces consistent results.

Change-Id: I61499631fa211ea482c79b2067d09889d9530b40

to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ide6ae6a5ea5d2279c42003f379b3a3460e62a525
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ide6ae6a5ea5d2279c42003f379b3a3460e62a525
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 15:16:39.000000000', 'files': ['templates/haproxy.cfg.j2'], 'message': 'Update syntax for haproxy 1.5 and 1.6

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to
follow the same bind syntax found in other HAP backends. This change
ensures that enabling stats does not break HAP.

Change-Id: Ie8dc737d0be95c53c8a6c6bb7d6506b5654ae215

(cherry picked from commit 63e358c990351270aedd9d614764bb9bfc4cb7e6)

commit_message:
Update syntax for haproxy 1.5 and 1.6

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to
follow the same bind syntax found in other HAP backends. This change
ensures that enabling stats does not break HAP.

Change-Id: Ie8dc737d0be95c53c8a6c6bb7d6506b5654ae215
Closes-Bug: #1635459
(cherry picked from commit 63e358c990351270aedd9d614764bb9bfc4cb7e6)

commit_message:
Update syntax for haproxy 1.5 and 1.6

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to
follow the same bind syntax found in other HAP backends. This change
ensures that enabling stats does not break HAP.

Change-Id: Ie8dc737d0be95c53c8a6c6bb7d6506b5654ae215
Closes-Bug: #1635459

subject: [DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 17:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I2da909236efbca3479492d9199d9ccbee77fa098
"}]
commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I2da909236efbca3479492d9199d9ccbee77fa098

subject: Fix default Swift ring partition power
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 14:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/swift-ringbuilder.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix default Swift ring partition power

Looks like swift::ringbuilder::part_power is not used at all; actually
the partition power on the overcloud is 18, which is the default in
puppet-swift if nothing else is defined.

Closes-Bug: 1631926
Depends-On: I78049105adf52226d47cc6764b1ba6c2c06e91e5
Change-Id: I65335c8d31ed1130e71f1e193eb519b9f7f2438e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default Swift ring partition power

Looks like swift::ringbuilder::part_power is not used at all; actually
the partition power on the overcloud is 18, which is the default in
puppet-swift if nothing else is defined.

Closes-Bug: 1631926
Depends-On: I78049105adf52226d47cc6764b1ba6c2c06e91e5
Change-Id: I65335c8d31ed1130e71f1e193eb519b9f7f2438e

commit_message:
Move aodh-api to wsgi under apache

Current aodh-api implementation can be run under wsgi or uwsgi,
by analogy with ceilometer setup in fuel-library, this commit moves
aodh-api to wsgi under apache

Change-Id: I96cd0ed44adef8c691bb5c1d98f788fe87858cad

commit_message:
Use keystone::authtoken for aodh

Upstream patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/378154 removes
deprecated parameters from aodh::api, so we need adapt
fuel-library and use aodh::keystone::authtoken instead

Closes-Bug: #1628488
Partial-Bug: #1477967

Change-Id: Ie391fc161cddf905d5675220e3e9cee85d6c5cd4

commit_message:
Correct bug in microversion headers in placement

Found a small bug in the handling of a 406 error by the placement API's
microversion handling code that only appeared when more than one
microversion was used.

Change-Id: I8562e9ce962352033e43a3b993f8b8ba6f211fd4

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-10-12 21:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/resource_class_cache.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': "Changed the name of the standard resource classes

Originally, the declared names for the resource classes defined in
objects/fields.py were an enum, as the original design assumed that any
future resource classes would be added as a software upgrade release. As
is the convention, this enum was given the name 'ALL'. With the
introduction of custom resource classes that can be added by admins, the
defined classes are no longer an enum, so the name 'ALL' is misleading.
This patch renames it to the more accurate 'STANDARD'.

Change-Id: I251a6faa8c284eb91d190b47108664e67d824425
Blueprint: custom-resource-classes
"}]
commit_message:
Changed the name of the standard resource classes

Originally, the declared names for the resource classes defined in
objects/fields.py were an enum, as the original design assumed that any
future resource classes would be added as a software upgrade release. As
is the convention, this enum was given the name 'ALL'. With the
introduction of custom resource classes that can be added by admins, the
defined classes are no longer an enum, so the name 'ALL' is misleading.
This patch renames it to the more accurate 'STANDARD'.

Change-Id: I251a6faa8c284eb91d190b47108664e67d824425
Blueprint: custom-resource-classes

commit_message:
Allow ARA to test different versions of Ansible in the gate

ARA supports Ansible>2. By testing against the different previous
stable releases as well as the latest unpinned, we can be sure not
to introduce a regression against a particular supported version of
Ansible.

Change-Id: Id1c83f2b8c848475dad1095ef0f0bc45de115d46

commit_message:
tests: Adding functional tests to cover VM creation with sriov

Adding HostPciSRIOVDevicesInfo class to fakelibvirt module
in order to dynamically generate host's SR-IOV devices info.

Adding functional tests to cover the creation of instances with
attached sriov devices (virtual and physical).
Verifying that VFs cannot be allocated when it's parent PF is allocated
and vice-versa, when a child VF is allocated, the parent PF should not
be available.

Change-Id: Ib9f341b0f26d48939d3305f6575f2689682c2685

commit_message:
ovsfw: Add a dl_type match for action=ct flows

Recently ovs has been changed to require a dl_type match for
action=ct flows.

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 12.2.7

configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and

copies any release notes from those roles.

commit_message:
[zmq] Don't fallback to topic if wrong server specified

When target is specified with server name the correct
result is empty if there is no records with this precise
name registered.

Change-Id: Ibaa7c23c633ccc5f2ca428deb022c9fc1d00e8e7

revisions:

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).

Change-Id: I0d2ec8ff3be41afb871ebd2aa71a8dfd13e2076d

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: I0d2ec8ff3be41afb871ebd2aa71a8dfd13e2076d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 11:09:54.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml'], 'message': 'Open port 16509 for libvirt for live migration

Port 16509 should be opened for tcp traffic to enable live migration.

See Also:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-configuring-migrations.html

Previously, we were not enabling any iptables rules on the Compute
Roles, so this is a regression.

Change-Id: Ie4abf53dc2a8171af48d02e34a1a3ad43f27cfb3
Closes-Bug: #1635427
(cherry picked from commit 1c4ade1d66450a49da9cb17528d21d47e000bf80)

commit_message:
Open port 16509 for libvirt for live migration

Port 16509 should be opened for tcp traffic to enable live migration.

See Also:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-configuring-migrations.html

Previously, we were not enabling any iptables rules on the Compute
Roles, so this is a regression.

Change-Id: Ie4abf53dc2a8171af48d02e34a1a3ad43f27cfb3
Closes-Bug: #1635427
(cherry picked from commit 1c4ade1d66450a49da9cb17528d21d47e000bf80)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.7

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable

subject: Prechecks fail if using separate api interface
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-14 11:17:02.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/prechecks/tasks/port_checks.yml'], 'message': 'Prechecks fail if using separate api interface

Internal VIP is assigned to api_interface but precheck tests the
address on network_interface. This fails if the interfaces are
different.

Change-Id: Id76580d8bc73448ffce3c2924a01330b8e070d97
Closes-Bug: #1571612
'}]
commit_message:
Prechecks fail if using separate api interface

Internal VIP is assigned to api_interface but precheck tests the
address on network_interface. This fails if the interfaces are
different.

Change-Id: Id76580d8bc73448ffce3c2924a01330b8e070d97
Closes-Bug: #1571612

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-19 15:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['other-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add bindep support

Bindep is an openstack-infra tool that allows projects to control
which packages are installed by default into a node. Since we are
running ansible, we only want to packages needed to run ansible.
Anything else should be installed by our playbooks.

Change-Id: I085862ad47fc8d07659d570a2303611930c41d51
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add bindep support

Bindep is an openstack-infra tool that allows projects to control
which packages are installed by default into a node. Since we are
running ansible, we only want to packages needed to run ansible.
Anything else should be installed by our playbooks.

Change-Id: I085862ad47fc8d07659d570a2303611930c41d51
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: add support deploying containerized ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-10-20 16:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/lib/ceph'], 'message': 'add support deploying containerized ceph

This commit introduces the support of deploying a containerized ceph
cluster. It relies on the ceph/demo container image available as part of
the ceph-docker project (https://github.com/ceph/ceph-docker).

To enable this scenario, just set CEPH_CONTAINERIZED to True, all the
previous available options will work. So settings like
CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE continue to work.

Change-Id: Ie10155140448c04b88b9920381b54505f7359585
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <seb@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add support deploying containerized ceph

This commit introduces the support of deploying a containerized ceph
cluster. It relies on the ceph/demo container image available as part of
the ceph-docker project (https://github.com/ceph/ceph-docker).

To enable this scenario, just set CEPH_CONTAINERIZED to True, all the
previous available options will work. So settings like
CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE continue to work.

Change-Id: Ie10155140448c04b88b9920381b54505f7359585
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <seb@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Removes EnableODL heat parameter and fixes missing local_ip param

EnableOpenDaylightOnController was not very composable.  Removing this
parameter to make the service truly composable.  Also fixes missing
local_ip setting for OVS, required for VXLAN or GRE tenant networks.

Closes-Bug: 1633625

Depends-On: Ia55c05e12d5d434111a13e1ed795da530e3ff4a5

Change-Id: I0e07e1631793311334d1436ee8fdf9af2802ba70

subject: Removes logic dependent on 'odl_on_controller'

Since moving to composable service/roles there was some logic here that

commit_message:
Removes logic dependent on 'odl_on_controller'

Since moving to composable service/roles there was some logic here that
was relying on a variable to enable ODL rather than enabling the service
itself to decide where ODL was enabled.  Now that ODL and ODL OVS
configuration are split into 2 different services we can make these
truly composable.

Partial-Bug: 1633625

Change-Id: Ia55c05e12d5d434111a13e1ed795da530e3ff4a5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Mds Relation

Small changes needed to make the mds relation function
properly. The mds_relation now uses the remote unit
name that to generate the cephx key. lib/ceph was also
synced to the latest.  Ceph_broker create cephfs
is now idempotent.

Change-Id: I8eb022030d833af6d1daa9b61265bde68f3e79b2

To remind reviewers, The Liberty and Mitaka releases
for OpenStack-Ansible are both tagged 'independent'
and not cycle releases. The same file must therefore
be changed to facilitate the release.

This patch is on top of the Mitaka release patch and

commit_message:
Release OpenStack-Ansible Liberty/12.2.6

To remind reviewers, The Liberty and Mitaka releases
for OpenStack-Ansible are both tagged 'independent'
and not cycle releases. The same file must therefore
be changed to facilitate the release.

This patch is on top of the Mitaka release patch and
will therefore fail the CI verification of tags until
the Mitaka release patch has merged.

Change-Id: I4ae80ef3a9fa82ae2bf78c0fe469af682e58afcb

subject: Change worker defaults to ::os_workers
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-20 20:20:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/os_workers_for_worker_count-3517788058682645.yaml', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_db_sync_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Iae9e5c6e5a5f68cb7f0a0dfc0edb0d21912cda19
'}]
commit_message:
Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Iae9e5c6e5a5f68cb7f0a0dfc0edb0d21912cda19

commit_message:
Make Murano always use the latest CoreLibrary

When we updating environment Murano doesn't update
CoreLibrary if it's already installed. So we need
to make it always install latest CoreLibrary version.

Change-Id: I361ac156f4059f0a100ae192654403cd328c90c3
Closes-Bug: #1624723

commit_message:
Add _member_ role to Swift operator list

Newly created users unable to interract with Swift by default,
to fix this, we need to add _member_ role to Swift operator list.

Change-Id: Ia4a2ab35efa0e4304b9aba39d59c643848aa123e
Closes-Bug: #1561241

commit_message:
Switch horizon to use versionless keystone endpoint

According to horizon patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321640/,
horizon now supports versionless keystone endpoint, so we need
to use versionless endpoint by default to be consistent with
other components.

Change-Id: I30c4382188f1c10d2a862b7db89b2bc9666d9c2d

commit_message:
Downcase all hostnames for MySQL user/db creation

Mysql puppet providers apply downcase method for hostnames, that
lead us to errors when we use hostnames with upper-case letters.

Change-Id: If94ed4d5cc6c0fb9a0db27dcc1c7ea45ccfb963a
Closes-Bug: #1537325

commit_message:
Make nova-consoleauth use memcache as cache backend

Now Mirantis OpenStack uses python dictionary's to store
nova-consoleauth tokens and it fails to connect to VNC on
page reload if we use HA cluster, so we need to use
memcache as cache backend.

Change-Id: I7da25b331f5665ec1b82544f476aebefdfa6113d
Closes-Bug: #1576218
(cherry picked from commit fc333aab261e6d255dbf818d2d48ec332f20feb3)

ovs neutron plugin, but it missed to change ml2_conf.ini.j2
correspondingly.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/373455/

Change-Id: I1937e1e5986657470add07d4bcf8587642aa45ec
Closes-bug: #1631903
(cherry picked from commit 1706e17ae921ec436410b9824433c1805506a1a1)

This adds an environment file that can be used to enable TLS in
the internal endpoints via certmonger if used. This will include
a nested stack that will create the hash that will be used to
create the certmonger certificates.

When setting up a service over apache via puppet, we used to disable
explicitly ssl (which sets modd_ssl-related fields for that vhost).
We now make this depend on the EnableInternalTLS flag. This has only
been done for keystone, but more services will be added as the
puppet code lands

bp tls-via-certmonger

Depends-On: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039
Change-Id: I12e794f2d4076be9505dabfe456c1ca6cfbd359c
'}]
commit_message:
Generate internal TLS hieradata for apache services

This adds an environment file that can be used to enable TLS in
the internal endpoints via certmonger if used. This will include
a nested stack that will create the hash that will be used to
create the certmonger certificates.

When setting up a service over apache via puppet, we used to disable
explicitly ssl (which sets modd_ssl-related fields for that vhost).
We now make this depend on the EnableInternalTLS flag. This has only
been done for keystone, but more services will be added as the
puppet code lands

bp tls-via-certmonger

Depends-On: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039
Change-Id: I12e794f2d4076be9505dabfe456c1ca6cfbd359c

This optionally enables TLS for keystone in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the keystone
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039
'}]
commit_message:
Enable TLS in the internal network for keystone

This optionally enables TLS for keystone in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the keystone
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039

subject: Add the workflow name to the starting workflow message
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}, {'_account_id': 9317, 'name': 'Ana Krivokapic', 'email': 'akrivoka@redhat.com', 'username': 'akrivoka'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-10 13:37:05.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/workflows/base.py'], 'message': 'Add the workflow name to the starting workflow message

It turns out that "Started Mistral Workflow. Execution ID:
58b6090b-7afb-4259-979c-f7a42b6de144" is not a particularly useful
message.

Include the Workflow name in the message to give the user more context.
Then it would be something like "Starting Mistral Workflow
tripleo.baremetal.register_or_update. Execution ID: ..." which explains
itself far more.

This change also adds the message to two baremetal workflow calls that
previously didn't include it.

Change-Id: I63e97ae88681dbf5aa29cb43f6d944061df6b7e0
'}]
commit_message:
Add the workflow name to the starting workflow message

It turns out that "Started Mistral Workflow. Execution ID:
58b6090b-7afb-4259-979c-f7a42b6de144" is not a particularly useful
message.

Include the Workflow name in the message to give the user more context.
Then it would be something like "Starting Mistral Workflow
tripleo.baremetal.register_or_update. Execution ID: ..." which explains
itself far more.

This change also adds the message to two baremetal workflow calls that
previously didn't include it.

Change-Id: I63e97ae88681dbf5aa29cb43f6d944061df6b7e0

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected the expected value.
  observed the observed value.
  message optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I8bd1bf8e93fe4babc25a955dcfbeca2c38f5c9a6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected the expected value.
  observed the observed value.
  message optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I8bd1bf8e93fe4babc25a955dcfbeca2c38f5c9a6

commit_message:
Pre-add instance actions to avoid merge conflicts

NotificationAction enum values for instance actions are added in a
single commit to avoid merge conflicts when it is added one by one
during the notification transformation.

Also the notification samples added as comments for the same reason.

Change-Id: Idfe41af8718bf5e81ea1608f4c6d00d7cf60cd13
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-ocata

commit_message:
Tune enum fields for validation

The Enum from oslo.versionobjects is not supporting 'enum' validation
properly, especially when the value can be None (null in JSON term).
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ie0f64333614351078839a9da915df8cf1afc37c7

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-20 16:16:05.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-auth-system-b2cd247b8a312b72.yaml', 'novaclient/exceptions.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v2/client.py', 'novaclient/auth_plugin.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_auth_plugins.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Remove support for non-keystone auth systems

The support for non-keystone auth systems and plugins
was deprecated with 1f11840dd84f3570330d1fcd53d1e8eea5ff7922
back in the 3.1.0 release in mitaka.

Now that we're working on shoring up the support for
keystone auth sessions in the client and eventually moving
to remove support for the non-session HTTPClient, we should
also remove the support to load non-keystone auth plugins.

The whole concept of non-keystone auth systems/plugins is
a legacy artifact and is a barrier to interoperability which
is a goal of nova and OpenStack in general.

Change-Id: Ia649db257c416ca054977812ecb3f1a8044fa584
"}]
commit_message:
Remove support for non-keystone auth systems

The support for non-keystone auth systems and plugins
was deprecated with 1f11840dd84f3570330d1fcd53d1e8eea5ff7922
back in the 3.1.0 release in mitaka.

Now that we're working on shoring up the support for
keystone auth sessions in the client and eventually moving
to remove support for the non-session HTTPClient, we should
also remove the support to load non-keystone auth plugins.

The whole concept of non-keystone auth systems/plugins is
a legacy artifact and is a barrier to interoperability which
is a goal of nova and OpenStack in general.

Change-Id: Ia649db257c416ca054977812ecb3f1a8044fa584

commit_message:
Open port 16509 for libvirt for live migration

Port 16509 should be opened for tcp traffic to enable live migration.

See Also:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-configuring-migrations.html

Previously, we were not enabling any iptables rules on the Compute
Roles, so this is a regression.

Change-Id: Ie4abf53dc2a8171af48d02e34a1a3ad43f27cfb3

commit_message:
Enable propagate_task_deploy in Web UI

So that it could be set by a user.
Also error message is returned in a structured way so that UI could
display it.
Also partial update of cluster attributes is supported.

Change-Id: Ib4a434039213cc91e0514240e722b7266f158ec5
Closes-Bug: #1621429
(cherry picked from commit d00f3d9228496bf25354dd4d6b6bdeaceecc2ad1)

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2016-09-07 07:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'message': "Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router. Let this become
the last guard in L3 agent side.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Related-Bug: #1607381
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router. Let this become
the last guard in L3 agent side.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Related-Bug: #1607381

commit_message:
modify description of "Inject guest networking config"

The description of "Inject guest networking config" in
support-matrix is misleading. Correct it.
In fact, If we config static ip,
guest os can not access metadata service to get ip config.
Closes-Bug: #1612913

Change-Id: I1892e5273a77516dd8e1525e6064fb95fa65e4d3
(cherry picked from commit 4ca189acd4c62f3921b5173d0da586abee0d5946)

commit_message:
[vncproxy] log for closing web is misleading

When user close console web, log will record "Target closed vmsg".
In fact, Target is not closed, webclient is closed

Change-Id: I7bb53c38c4969eee7cf1d2ee346797d31c8b2d6a
Closes-Bug: #1596873
(cherry picked from commit 754adc4b7eafa6ef0da7b0d2f5e5f304f436d022)

commit_message:
Use %autosetup instead of %setup

This simplifies the process of adding patches to spec files.
Adding a patch is then just adding a %patch source and %Autosetup
will apply the patches in order.

Also add a speccheck for that case.

Change-Id: Ic4a925d800f3816b6cea865f779aa455e5b5a592

subject: Disable Swift auditors and replicators on the undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-20 15:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': 'Disable Swift auditors and replicators on the undercloud

Swift is using only a single replica on the undercloud. Therefore
recovering from a corrupted or lost object is not possible, and running

'}]
commit_message:
Disable Swift auditors and replicators on the undercloud

Swift is using only a single replica on the undercloud. Therefore
recovering from a corrupted or lost object is not possible, and running
replicators and auditors only wastes resources.

Closes-Bug: 1632885
Change-Id: Ic93082282e9ea481c13832f8ce1265a47f0ef3d5

subject: Ensure a diff does not cause a non-zero return code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 18:01:02.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/run-tox-with-oslo-master.sh'], 'message': "Ensure a diff does not cause a non-zero return code

Currently periodic jobs for oslo are failing since
tox was thinking the oslo-from-master.sh from master
script was dying. It wasn't actually, this should
fix that by making sure the diff command doesn't return
non-zero (we expect a difference).

Also show the post-alteration tox.ini, so that its
easier to see if a change to it is invalid (especially
when there are some further issue).

Change-Id: I6a73bab746f22e5ae749dc798a189c9f255cddda
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure a diff does not cause a non-zero return code

Currently periodic jobs for oslo are failing since
tox was thinking the oslo-from-master.sh from master
script was dying. It wasn't actually, this should
fix that by making sure the diff command doesn't return
non-zero (we expect a difference).

Also show the post-alteration tox.ini, so that its
easier to see if a change to it is invalid (especially
when there are some further issue).

Change-Id: I6a73bab746f22e5ae749dc798a189c9f255cddda

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.11.0 in test-requirements

Hacking's latest release is 0.11.0. Most other ironic projects are using
this release.

These updates are done project-by-project to avoid introducing
unexpected new hacking rules to projects. This version bump already
applies cleanly to python-ironic-inspector-client with no code style
changes.

subject: Wait longer for installer to be ready
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 09:49:09.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/virtualbox-install_base.sh'], 'message': "Wait longer for installer to be ready

After starting the VM for building the basedisk, we currently wait for
5 seconds for the installer to be ready before we start sending our
prepared keyboard input.

This patch increases the waiting time to 10 seconds.

Rationale: 5 seconds is just about enough. On a fairly typical laptop,
it becomes a race, on a slower laptop, chances are the installer won't
be ready by the time we start giving it commands. If we don't wait long
enough, the installation will fail. Ideally, we would have a different
method of detecting that the installer is ready. For now, we just have to
try and err on the side of caution.

backport: From master.
Change-Id: I6dfb96d758c1facbc0b4db570b80c36132fa561e
"}]
commit_message:
Wait longer for installer to be ready

After starting the VM for building the basedisk, we currently wait for
5 seconds for the installer to be ready before we start sending our
prepared keyboard input.

This patch increases the waiting time to 10 seconds.

Rationale: 5 seconds is just about enough. On a fairly typical laptop,
it becomes a race, on a slower laptop, chances are the installer won't
be ready by the time we start giving it commands. If we don't wait long
enough, the installation will fail. Ideally, we would have a different
method of detecting that the installer is ready. For now, we just have to
try and err on the side of caution.

backport: From master.
Change-Id: I6dfb96d758c1facbc0b4db570b80c36132fa561e

commit_message:
Move unit tests to a separate folder

Until recently, os-win did not have any functional tests. As we're
now starting to add such tests, we need to clearly separate unit
tests.

Note that most OpenStack projects have already done this separation.

This change moves the unit tests to a separate folder.

Change-Id: I1649fae7095f9b4024e526358ac70a58189365bf

This patch updates the Nova profile so that we set memcached

Most of the hiera settings for ::nova::keystone::authtoken are
already included in the t-h-t nova-api service.

Change-Id: I3b7ff02abbd0d5e0c38232d02b33e4c7bc411120

(cherry picked from commit 2e234e2e3510e405de2ff97754b96681bf49bcff)

commit_message:
Set memcached_servers for nova API

This patch updates the Nova profile so that we set memcached
servers correctly for the Nova keystone auth_token middleware.

Most of the hiera settings for ::nova::keystone::authtoken are
already included in the t-h-t nova-api service.

Change-Id: I3b7ff02abbd0d5e0c38232d02b33e4c7bc411120
Closes-bug: #1633595
(cherry picked from commit 2e234e2e3510e405de2ff97754b96681bf49bcff)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 11:08:19.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Reduce the tenants stack create timeout

Observing the logs this now take between 2 and 3 minutes. Reduce the
timout appropriatly so that we hit it early instead of waiting for 20
minutes(and possible hitting the global timout).

Related-Bug: #1578708
Change-Id: I692cf241ab08f7319b091b5a336e84ba8384f0d5

commit_message:
Reduce the tenants stack create timeout

Observing the logs this now take between 2 and 3 minutes. Reduce the
timout appropriatly so that we hit it early instead of waiting for 20
minutes(and possible hitting the global timout).

Related-Bug: #1578708
Change-Id: I692cf241ab08f7319b091b5a336e84ba8384f0d5

commit_message:
Disables Neutron ML2 config on Compute for OpenDaylight

This is not needed with ODL and actually triggers deployments to fail
due to missing ODL username/password info on compute nodes.

Depends-On: Ifd906db4e6062ac271c2147fe1149b1009d06ae2

Closes-Bug: 1633630

Change-Id: Ib88e8ef91c393d30c44b86a932103f5a294bc547
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6b9fe61995d3cece93fa152b2ef9120690b957b2)

commit_message:
Fixes missing ODL ML2 Authentication info

Without this, neutron-server fails to start and communication will not
work to ODL REST.

Parital-Bug: 1633630

Change-Id: Ifd906db4e6062ac271c2147fe1149b1009d06ae2
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a970cf81d8b06c6999966b20ad2b4c980b3b107b)

commit_message:
Show tenant_id in *-list by admin

If API call is done by admin, neutron API returns all resources
from all tenants. We received several times a request that
tenant_id is useful in such case.

This patch displays tenant_id column when *-list is invoked
by a user with 'admin' role by default. If columns to be displayed
are specified by '-c' option, the specified columns are honored
and tenant_id columns is not added.

Add functional tests to cover this change. This feature depends
on keystoneauth1 and unit tests cannot cover this change.

Closes-Bug: #1526238
Change-Id: Id58a0b795f76b4fe24aaf89f1f6486c23f19a553

commit_message:
Stricter validation for cluster-create

This patch enables the ClusteCreateRequestBody to use the CapacityField
for stricter value validation. It also ensures that the 'timeout' field
specified is not a negative integer.

Change-Id: I928959c68f879d3f4cb7a025aeafd3120890c783

commit_message:
Add 'Boolean' and 'AdjustmentType' fields

The oslo version of 'Boolean' field (type) is virtually not usuable.
We propose our own reason for validation's purpose. The AdjustmentType
field type is a lot easier to understand.

Change-Id: I4a140c290124899bc36cd0628cc3944a7f9bc345

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants in tests

There are several places in the source code where
HTTP response codes are used as numeric values.

These values are used from six.moves and the
numeric values are replaced by constants.

All of the used status codes were replaced with symbolic constants
from six.moves.http_client.
More about six.moves.http_client can be found at [2],
under the table "Supported renames:".

Also, this change improves code readibility.

This patchset does not extract numeric values from
the code itself, but it can be found at [1].

[1]: Ib9e26dcea927e96e65c626c18421621d3a29a64d
[2]: https://pythonhosted.org/six/#module-six.moves

Change-Id: Idfc7b043552f428f01ac3e47b270ee0639a8f5bc
Closes-Bug: #1520159

subject: correct options for mysql_install_db
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 07:46:47.000000000', 'files': ['debian/changelog', 'debian/test.sh', 'debian/control'], 'message': 'correct options for mysql_install_db

  * Using the correct options for mysql_install_db so that it continues to work
    with MySQL 5.7.x.
  * Build-Depends on default-mysql-client and default-mysql-server instead of
    mysql-client & mysql-server (the later is kept as an alternative).

Change-Id: I5532ad5d7afef7062a9cbb96ec3c03612b89485f
'}]
commit_message:
correct options for mysql_install_db

  * Using the correct options for mysql_install_db so that it continues to work
    with MySQL 5.7.x.
  * Build-Depends on default-mysql-client and default-mysql-server instead of
    mysql-client & mysql-server (the later is kept as an alternative).

Change-Id: I5532ad5d7afef7062a9cbb96ec3c03612b89485f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 13:46:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/test_emc_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_masking.py'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - Heat detach issue.

There is a threading issue in Heat on a delete stack. All
detaches happen simultaneously. The fix locks the portion
of code to determine accurately, the number of volumes left
in the storage group, at any given time, to prevent
attempting to remove a volume that is the last in the
storage group.

Change-Id: I84164a9abac35d962408febbe8d3af759beb6a94
Closes-Bug: #1630535
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Heat detach issue.

There is a threading issue in Heat on a delete stack. All
detaches happen simultaneously. The fix locks the portion
of code to determine accurately, the number of volumes left
in the storage group, at any given time, to prevent
attempting to remove a volume that is the last in the
storage group.

Change-Id: I84164a9abac35d962408febbe8d3af759beb6a94
Closes-Bug: #1630535

This change creates a puppet parser function to convert the
test_vm_image from hiera into a glance_image compatible array of hashes
that can be used with create_resources. Previously vmware deployments

upload_cirros task this ability was dropped.

Change-Id: I3f0f6da32134a4a15f2c4764c5334bb8e85309c8

commit_message:
Update upload_cirros to support multiple images

This change creates a puppet parser function to convert the
test_vm_image from hiera into a glance_image compatible array of hashes
that can be used with create_resources. Previously vmware deployments
included an extra TestVM to be uploaded but during the rewrite of the
upload_cirros task this ability was dropped.

Change-Id: I3f0f6da32134a4a15f2c4764c5334bb8e85309c8
Closes-Bug: #1635144
(cherry picked from commit 53f6229f636f607f5d7f8cd9f2e8669a73f9e6c2)

subject: Updated syntax for hap 1.5 and 1.6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 03:07:09.000000000', 'files': ['templates/haproxy.cfg.j2'], 'message': 'Updated syntax for hap 1.5 and 1.6

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to
follow the same bind syntax found in other HAP backends. This change
ensures that enabling stats does not break HAP.

Change-Id: I87cefc5032bf6064f6eab527f7b5cbe1b7fe704c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Updated syntax for hap 1.5 and 1.6

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to
follow the same bind syntax found in other HAP backends. This change
ensures that enabling stats does not break HAP.

Change-Id: I87cefc5032bf6064f6eab527f7b5cbe1b7fe704c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add grenade configuration for neutron-fwaas

A grenade job is required for neutron stadium compliance, so therefore a
grenade job should be added for neutron-fwaas.  Plus, it's just a good
thing to have.

Change-Id: I196973df2260ebbc88f891d6b02830b987e7a9c7

subject: Move octavia multinode scenario to check queue
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-19 13:04:05.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Move octavia multinode scenario to check queue

After merging the changes that make
gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-multinode-nv possible in
Iecc38aa950e8b5a4c42db6b609820443efe437c2 and
I2c8b00a7377e3106f7cd1221202232a3621afe53, we'd like to move it
to the check queue as a non voting job, to gather statistics on
stability and compare to the non-multinode scenario.

Change-Id: If3a2458183b7cd15217770e1b1d1852633f9ede0
Closes-bug: 1628481
"}]
commit_message:
Move octavia multinode scenario to check queue

After merging the changes that make
gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-multinode-nv possible in
Iecc38aa950e8b5a4c42db6b609820443efe437c2 and
I2c8b00a7377e3106f7cd1221202232a3621afe53, we'd like to move it
to the check queue as a non voting job, to gather statistics on
stability and compare to the non-multinode scenario.

Change-Id: If3a2458183b7cd15217770e1b1d1852633f9ede0
Closes-bug: 1628481

commit_message:
Support SSL and Insecure

Currently, Zaqarclient doesn't support SSL and insecure very well.
This patch fix it.

Implement blueprint: support-ssl-insecure

commit_message:
Fixed Shellcheck's warnings in murano-agent

Shellcheck complains like this:
meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-agent|26 col 3 warning|
In POSIX sh, 'local' is undefined. [SC2039] [sh/shellcheck]
And add quotes to prevent word splitting.

Change-Id: I99a296ebc33a101bcd0e4f9d824d3f217ec7c438
Closes-Bug: #1622384

subject: Fix TypeError being throw by wait_ready in Engine System Agent.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-14 04:57:52.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/agent.py'], 'message': 'Fix TypeError being throw by wait_ready in Engine System Agent.

Currently, wait_ready wrongly does call(template, False, timeout)
but the second param is expected to be a ResourceManager, leading
to the TypeError.

This fix replaces the wrong function call with
call_raw(template, timeout).

Change-Id: I57e92eae95efc3e68b51ea751d08dd87946f85cb
Closes-Bug: #1633176
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError being throw by wait_ready in Engine System Agent.

Currently, wait_ready wrongly does call(template, False, timeout)
but the second param is expected to be a ResourceManager, leading
to the TypeError.

This fix replaces the wrong function call with
call_raw(template, timeout).

Change-Id: I57e92eae95efc3e68b51ea751d08dd87946f85cb
Closes-Bug: #1633176

commit_message:
Pin ARA to 0.9.1 temporarily

The next release of ARA (0.10.0) contains a change to the callback
plugin location that /should/ be backwards compatible but let's
control the update to the newer version to be safe and avoid
breaking the gate needlessly.

subject: Fixes event ordering for alarm monitor and scale actions.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-06 15:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/vnfm/plugin.py', 'tacker/vnfm/monitor.py'], 'message': 'Fixes event ordering for alarm monitor and scale actions.

This commit adds code to support the below related to alarm
monitoring and scaling:
1.Consolidates the two event captures in the update_vnf_with_alarm
method into just a single event capture with alarm url details.
2.Captures events in update_vnf_with_alarm method when policy action
and alarm action name are missing.
3.Captures the event information for ActionAutoscalingHeat policy
action invocation and scaling action in the right time order.

Change-Id: Iea255a4f454fb0c721b152090514ad8ca8732890
Closes-Bug: #1629453
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes event ordering for alarm monitor and scale actions.

This commit adds code to support the below related to alarm
monitoring and scaling:
1.Consolidates the two event captures in the update_vnf_with_alarm
method into just a single event capture with alarm url details.
2.Captures events in update_vnf_with_alarm method when policy action
and alarm action name are missing.
3.Captures the event information for ActionAutoscalingHeat policy
action invocation and scaling action in the right time order.

Change-Id: Iea255a4f454fb0c721b152090514ad8ca8732890
Closes-Bug: #1629453

commit_message:
Cleanup of SecurityGroup classes

Commit Ifb70a118cef48c3c4cd313e22e907aa47bc51ad0 intended to remove some
classes, but without DeprecationWarnings. To prevent from possible
problems, if it would be now removed, added Warnings and included info,
about future removal.

Change-Id: Iacb93abc363bf638efc3acb5b29c02a7508bc43a
Related-Bug: #1444112

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 15:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/zmq/test_zmq_ttl_cache.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

Change-Id: I192e339fadc6b738714697d1ae8673ebfb7abd79
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

Change-Id: I192e339fadc6b738714697d1ae8673ebfb7abd79

commit_message:
Validate mapping exists when creating/updating a protocol

This patch validates that a mapping exists when adding or updating
a federation protocol.

Change-Id: I996f94d26eb0f2c679542ba13a03bbaa4442486a
Closes-Bug: #1571878

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-23 12:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': '[Trivial] Refactor the using of dict.get() in the test assertion

In this patch, we will refactor the test assertions
in which there are dict.get(key), with a explicit
way(i.e. dict[key]), or assert the existence of key
directly with assertNotIn().

Change-Id: Ieb6137cb1cb3ec1c6e4e9d51fa0f74f17e363be9
'}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] Refactor the using of dict.get() in the test assertion

In this patch, we will refactor the test assertions
in which there are dict.get(key), with a explicit
way(i.e. dict[key]), or assert the existence of key
directly with assertNotIn().

Change-Id: Ieb6137cb1cb3ec1c6e4e9d51fa0f74f17e363be9

subject: Perfect the file information in openstack CLI
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-10-13 12:34:21.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/cli-manage-volumes.rst'], 'message': 'Perfect the file information in openstack CLI

This patch is aim to perfect this file,it modify some invalid command
for volume operation.And it deprecated some[1] of cinder CLI instead of
use openstack CLI.

[1]:There are some CLI have not been realized for openstack CLI:
         cinder migrate
         cinder transfer
         cinder snapshot manage/unmanage

Change-Id: Id997f9bdd5ab4de225b01b8261e2fb80745e06a6
'}]
commit_message:
Perfect the file information in openstack CLI

This patch is aim to perfect this file,it modify some invalid command
for volume operation.And it deprecated some[1] of cinder CLI instead of
use openstack CLI.

[1]:There are some CLI have not been realized for openstack CLI:
         cinder migrate
         cinder transfer
         cinder snapshot manage/unmanage

Change-Id: Id997f9bdd5ab4de225b01b8261e2fb80745e06a6

commit_message:
Update .coveragerc after the removal of openstack directory

The openstack directory was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: Ifcf1a4388bd886d5d04675a54112857d99d43586
